Operating these vessels can be lucrative for its captains, but the Korath authorities require them to activate their self destruct in the event of a mutiny or other event that could result in a prisoner escape. Whether or not they have the fortitude to fulfill this duty is put to the test whenever they engage in a boarding battle.

variants.name: Marauder Kestrel (Kestrel (Bloodwind))
variants.description: Several years ago, while visiting a sweat lodge in search of spiritual renewal, Tarazed's chief ship designer fell into a trance and journeyed to a reality separate from our own. There he saw visions of a strange and elegant starship. Returning to his work with renewed purpose, he spent the next seven years making the Kestrel a reality.

variants.name: Shrike (Shrike (Gravedigger))
variants.description: The Shrike is a nimble gunship that is usually outfitted to provide long distance fire support. Remnant captains embarking on solo missions might opt for a more aggressive outfit selection instead.

variants.name: Wren (Wren (Gravedigger))
variants.description: Thanks to its cloaking technology, the Wren provides discreet transportation to remote Remnant research outposts. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Wren's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

variants.name: Marauder Vanguard (Marauder Vanguard (Sheragi Counterfeit))
variants.description: This Syndicate Shipyards Vanguard has been customized with additional armored plating as well as upgraded shielding to accommodate the latest experimental technologies.

variants.name: Diamondback (Diamondback (Bounty))
variants.description: Diamondbacks have been in use since explorers first settled the galactic rim. They've fought in various wars throughout the centuries and few survive to this day. Those that have are so extensively customized that no two are alike. Some southern legends claim the Diamondbacks were wrecked spacecraft created by extinct aliens and salvaged by early explorers such as Han Sizer. There is no evidence to support these claims and no reputable scholar takes them seriously.

variants.name: Deep River Carrier (Deep River Carrier (Full))
variants.description: This is a Deep River freighter that has had some of its cargo container mounts modified to carry drones.

variants.name: Deep River Carrier (Deep River Carrier (Half))
variants.description: This is a Deep River freighter that has had some of its cargo container mounts modified to carry drones.

variants.name: Storm Seeker (Storm Seeker Reborn)
variants.description: An old relic from a time when the Wanderers occupied what is now southern human space, the Storm Seeker is a security patrol ship with an array of information warfare technologies built directly into the hull.

variants.name: Thunder Maker (Thunder Maker B)
variants.description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.

variants.name: Thunder Maker (Thunder Maker C)
variants.description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.

variants.name: Thunder Maker (Thunder Maker (Modern))
variants.description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.

outfits.name: Pyrite
outfits.description: Also known as Fool's Gold, Pyrite is a common component in the manufacture of photovoltaic panels. It is also used in magnetic data storage technologies and non-rechargeable batteries.

outfits.name: Quantumium
outfits.description: The raw ore used to make Quantum Keystones. Since it has not been processed, it occupies more space than a Quantum Keystone does.

outfits.name: Deuterium
outfits.description: Deuterium is normally harvested from the cloudy atmostpheres of gas giants. However, it can also be found frozen in the icy cores of wandering comets.

outfits.name: Fossil
outfits.description: This is a rare relic. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Mysterious Treasure
outfits.description: This may be a rare artifact. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Earth Artifact
outfits.description: This is a rare artifact. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Alien Artifact
outfits.description: This is a rare artifact. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Space Junk
outfits.description: Centuries after they've ceased functioning, the wreckage of old satellites and probes can still be found littering space. The reward for recycling this junk isn't much, but if you won't do your part to keep the galaxy clean, who will?

outfits.name: Dysprosium
outfits.description: Dysprosium is never naturally found as a free element. Many industries in a spacefaring civilization have a use for it.

outfits.name: Krypton
outfits.description: Krypton is used in nuclear fusion energy research and experimental particle physics.

outfits.name: Radon
outfits.description: Radon is used in some radiation cancer therapies. Ironically, due to its radioactive properties, it is also a carcinogen.

outfits.name: Xenon
outfits.description: Xenon is the preferred propellant used by Ion Engines since it is more environmentally friendly and less corrosive than other alternatives.

outfits.name: Hackerz Plugin Omega
outfits.description: This cannot be uninstalled while the other outfit is installed, so use this with caution.

outfits.name: Hackerz Plugin Alpha
outfits.description: This cannot be uninstalled unless the other outfit is installed, so use this with caution.

outfits.name: Hackerz Plugin Sigma
outfits.description: This cannot be installed onto a ship that doesn't have a spinal mount or if something is already installed in its spinal mount.

outfits.name: Popcorn Box
outfits.description: Certain rare missions are more likely to trigger while this is installed on your flagship.

outfits.name: Rusty Asteroid Scanner
outfits.description: The circuits of this rusty old asteroid scanner are fused into your ship, but it still works. Unfortunately the effective range is so low you might not realize an asteroid is minable until you're practically on top of it.

outfits.name: Gremlin Circuits
outfits.description: Some fused circuits from when you salvaged parts to make the Gremlin. You never got around to fixing it, but they're not connected to anything important so it should be fine...

outfits.name: Food?
outfits.description: This is barely edible, but it should be able to keep you going for another day.

outfits.name: Speck Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Speck Tech License
outfits.description: The Aberrant threat has loosened any restrictions the Twilight Guard would normally have on sharing this technology.

outfits.name: Nettle Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Nettle Tech License
outfits.description: The Aberrant threat has loosened any restrictions the Twilight Guard would normally have on sharing this technology.

outfits.name: Voidjelly
outfits.description: Voidjellies are poisonous and have almost no commercial value. They are, however, a favorite food of certain large Voidfish that are immune to the toxin. A high enough concentration of them within a water droplet is likely to attract a Voidlunker.

outfits.name: Voidlunker
outfits.description: This is a rare catch. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Murkfish
outfits.description: Most of the voidborne fish found in the dark waters of Murk appear even more alien than those caught in Gossamer. This exotic appearance is enhanced by a larger representation of species exhibiting some form of bioluminescence.

outfits.name: Rotting Murk Flesh
outfits.description: The flesh itself is too far gone to have any market value, but it is teeming with crustaceans, mollusks, and other small invertebrates feeding upon it. These scavengers seem like they might be edible if cooked properly.

outfits.name: Wither Wood
outfits.description: Underneath the tree's rotting exterior, Wither Wood shines with an unearthly glow. The bio-matter has been imbued with high levels of radioactive uranium. Whether natural evolution or artificial bio-engineering caused this is a mystery. Some may find this substance useful as an alternative energy source or weapons development material. But it probably wouldn't be a good idea to sell these at a concerts as glow sticks.

outfits.name: Orange Optical Laser
outfits.description: The three lasers mounted on this heavy turret are effective at smelting asteroids and harvesting other interstellar resources. They also generate more heat than most other Avgi lasers, both on the ship they are installed on as well as any ship they strike. An optical lasing generator is integrated into the weapon, contributing to its considerable size and weight.

outfits.name: Prismatic Optical Laser
outfits.description: This heavy turret was designed during a time when the Avgi were still uncertain which wavelengths are ideal for defending against missiles. An integrated optical lasing generator cycles through the spectrum, creating a dazzling effect that greatly disrupts optical tracking systems.

outfits.name: Red Optical Laser
outfits.description: This specialized gun was designed for smelting asteroids and harvesting other interstellar resources. An optical lasing generator is integrated into the weapon, making it simpler to install but less compatible with modern Avgi laser weapons.

outfits.name: Speck Magazine Depot
outfits.description: The Speck Magazine Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Speck Rounds. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Deflector Lamina
outfits.description: Deflector Laminae take advantage of special external hardpoints built into most Avgi ships, allowing them to be mounted without taking up any outfit space. However, they also tend to increase the amount of heat absorbed from the local star.

outfits.name: Harvester Scanner
outfits.description: This compact scanner is configured to assist short range data collection for Void Harvesters instead of providing long range tactical data.

outfits.name: Harvester Spectrometer
outfits.description: This compact set of spectrometers is specialized for analyzing the spectral signatures of natural raw materials in order to determine their composition. It lacks the functionality to identify manufactured goods and equipment.

outfits.name: Avgi Harvester License
outfits.description: The tiny Voidfish dangling from the chain looks remarkably life-like. Shaking it back and forth makes it appear as if it's trying to slip off a fishing hook.

outfits.name: Bunrodean Artifact License
outfits.description: The outfitter occasionally shows off rare artifacts that aren't actually for sale.

outfits.name: Swarm Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Swarm Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Swarm Missiles. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Swarm Missiles even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Swarm Clip Depot
outfits.description: The Swarm Clip Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Swarm Missiles. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Thermal Insulator
outfits.description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

outfits.name: Lasher Rifle
outfits.description: Unlike modern Lasher Pistols, this weapon utilizes brutally savage design principles more suitable for attack than defense. It is a testament to a less civilized era in Bunrodean antiquity.

outfits.name: Heliarch Corruption
outfits.description: Evidence of corrupt activities involving a Heliarch official.

outfits.name: Camouflaged Blaster
outfits.description: Someone redesigned an old Energy Cannon to resemble a Coalition Model Cannon. The outer casing incorporates scanning interference material to help conceal its internal circuitry. These weapons are popular with both criminals and dissidents within the Coalition, allowing them to covertly arm their ships without drawing attention from the Heliarchs.

outfits.name: Camouflaged Blaster Turret
outfits.description: Three Energy Cannons disguised to resemble Coalition Model Cannons are mounted on this turret. The outer casing incorporates scanning interference material to help conceal its internal circuitry.

outfits.name: Coalition Attractor
outfits.description: Coalition Attractors played a pivotal role in the Saryd's ability to control early battles against the Quarg. Heliarch technicians would later refine this technology into a more powerful weapon.

outfits.name: Coalition Repulsor
outfits.description: Coalition Repulsors allowed Saryd escorts to keep enemy ships away from vulnerable targets. However, they lack some of the features that the Heliarch would later develop when enhancing this technology.

outfits.name: Deflector Emitter
outfits.description: In addition to occupying a turret mount, each emitter installed will increase stress on the shield generators, raising consumption of resources used to replenish your shields.

outfits.name: Model Cannon
outfits.description: weapon

outfits.name: Model Turret
outfits.description: This Model Turret is a non-functional representation of an actual Bombardment Turret. Civilian ship collectors in the Coalition use these to decorate their ships for added aesthetic authenticity.

outfits.name: Culminator Pod
outfits.description: Unlike Finishers, Culminators launch hot. This shortens their range since they burn out more quickly.

outfits.name: Culminator Storage Tube
outfits.description: Culminator Storage Tubes are more compact than Finisher Storage Tubes, but lack the additional energy storage capacity of its modern counterpart.

outfits.name: Culminator Storage Depot
outfits.description: The Culminator Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Culminator Torpedoes. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Culminator Torpedo
outfits.description: This extremely powerful missile is ammunition for the Coalition Culminator Pod. Not as maneuverable as a Finisher Torpedo and equipped with simpler tracking technology, a Culminator strike is still as destructive as that of their modern equivalents.

outfits.name: Finisher Storage Depot
outfits.description: The Finisher Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Finisher Torpedoes. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Coalition Scanner
outfits.description: This antique scanner is far less powerful than the Scanning Modules used by the Heliarchs, but it has additional features more suitable for exploration and research.

outfits.name: Fuel Dissipator
outfits.description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

outfits.name: Coalition Reactor Cluster
outfits.description: Coalition Reactor Clusters are less modular than their modern Heliarch equivalents.

outfits.name: Riot Containment Barrier
outfits.description: While Riot Containment Barriers are typically deployed by the Heliarchs to keep civil unrest under control, these are technically not weapons. A growing market of citizens concerned about dissidents is starting to have these installed on their ships.

outfits.name: Saryd Light Lance
outfits.description: The tip of this spear charges and holds an energy bolt that can be used to enhance the wielder's strikes in melee or be flung at an enemy from a distance.

outfits.name: Finisher Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Finisher Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Finisher Torpedos. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Finisher Torpedos even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Culminator Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Culminator Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Culminator Torpedos. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Culminator Torpedos even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Graviton Channeler
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Quantum Paradox Diffusion
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Quantum Paradox Inversion
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Quantum Paradox Propulsion
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Imaginary Number Fusion Matrix
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Omni-Directional Photonic Emitter
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Space Differential Stabilizer
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Zero Division Core
outfits.description: You have no idea how this works.

outfits.name: Murkspores
outfits.description: If these spores are left on your ship, Murkmold may eventually start growing there.

outfits.name: Murkmold Bay
outfits.description: This portion of your cargo bay is infested with Murkmold. Most sentient species quickly ban it once they discover its dangerous hallucinogenic effects...

outfits.name: Murkmold Bunks
outfits.description: This bunk room is infested with Murkmold, a protein rich primordial ooze that forms on Murkmold patches. While in this state, it is uninhabitable for your crew.

outfits.name: Murkmold
outfits.description: "Spread the mold..."

outfits.name: Rock Scavenger Meat
outfits.description: Although it looks disgusting, rock scavenger meat is considered a delicacy in the Paradise Planets. Restaurants will pay large sums of money for it.

outfits.name: Pollen?
outfits.description: Achoo!

outfits.name: Murkspores?
outfits.description: If these spores are aboard your ship, some sort of fungus may eventually start growing there.

outfits.name: Bioroid (Crushed)
outfits.description: The bioroid's delicate casing was crushed. The scrambled biomatter leaking out leaves a goopy mess on the floor.

outfits.name: Liquid Metal Specimen
outfits.description: If found, return to the Syndicate offices at the Foundry spaceport in the Achernar system.

outfits.name: Gray Eye Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Luminazoa Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Leech Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Nautilus Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Plasma Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Firefly Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Gazer Specimen
outfits.description: This is a rare specimen. You can install it on your ship to keep it from getting mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Nightmare Fuel License
outfits.description: You have witnessed things rational minds were not meant to see. Now, strange phantoms hover just beyond your field of vision and you hear faint echoes breaking moments of silence. It is as if the thin veneer of sanity has been torn ever so slightly, granting you awareness of another reality interposed with our own...

outfits.name: Haunted Accommodations
outfits.description: Ever since you had your own strange experience here you haven't set foot in it again. The Haunted Accomodations appears normal, but ship status reports indicate that it no longer occupies as much space as it used to.

outfits.name: Unknown Element
outfits.description: This doesn't match anything in your ship's database. It could be very valuable to the right person.

outfits.name: Light Scrap Plating
outfits.description: Welding this onto your hull will slow your ship down considerably. While it can be layered for more protection, the added weight is also cumulative.

outfits.name: Heavy Scrap Plating
outfits.description: Welding this onto your hull will slow your ship down considerably. While it can be layered for more protection, the added weight is also cumulative.

outfits.name: Thermal Scrap Plating
outfits.description: This must go through a smelting process with certain materials to weld it to your hull. Welding this onto your hull will slow your ship down considerably. While it can be layered for more protection, the added weight is also cumulative.

outfits.name: Slag
outfits.description: Slag leftover from obliterated hull plating. Weapons fire from dozens of battles have rendered its base metals unrecognizable and unsalvageable.

outfits.name: Aluminum Ingot
outfits.description: Aluminum that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Copper Ingot
outfits.description: Copper that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Gold Ingot
outfits.description: Gold that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Iron Ingot
outfits.description: Iron that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Lead Ingot
outfits.description: Lead that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Neodymium Ingot
outfits.description: Neodymium that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Platinum Ingot
outfits.description: Platinum that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Pyrite Ingot
outfits.description: Pyrite that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Silicon Ingot
outfits.description: Silicon that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Silver Ingot
outfits.description: Silver that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Titanium Ingot
outfits.description: Titanium that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Tungsten Ingot
outfits.description: Tungsten that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Uranium Ingot
outfits.description: Uranium that has been processed for industrial use.

outfits.name: Genesis Flak Shell Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Genesis Flak Shell Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Genesis Flak Shells. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Genesis Flak Shells even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: High Calibur Ammo Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: High Calibur Ammo Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture High Calibur Ammo. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer High Calibur Ammo even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Genesis Mining Laser
outfits.description: This is bulky laser isn't very effective against shields. The inhabitants of Genesis have put it to use as a mining tool, allowing their ships to save ammunition for threats more dangerous than asteroids.

outfits.name: Genesis Anti-Missile
outfits.description: Genesis Anti-Missile turrets require a crew member to operate and have some other minor differences from the similarly sized Anti-Missile Turrets used by humans.

outfits.name: Genesis Flak Shell
outfits.description: Genesis ammunition, professionally manufactured by their industrial mass production factories, is a critical element to many of their weapons. Quality control measures at these facilities make them less likely to jam.

outfits.name: Genesis Flak Shell Crate
outfits.description: The Genesis Flak Shell Crate is used to store extra ammunition for Genesis Flak Turrets.

outfits.name: Genesis Flak Shell Depot
outfits.description: The Genesis Flak Shell Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Genesis Flak Shells. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Genesis Flak Turret
outfits.description: Genesis mechanical weapons technology is far ahead of their energy weapons development. The loading systems on them are less likely to jam compared to species that put more resources on developing their energy weapons.

outfits.name: Frozen Shard Turret
outfits.description: Genesis mechanical weapons technology is far ahead of their energy weapons development. The loading systems on them are less likely to jam compared to species that put more resources on developing their energy weapons.

outfits.name: High Calibur Ammo
outfits.caliber: refers to the diameter of a gun's barrel. Guns are meant to be loaded with bullets that match their caliber. This ammunition is appropriately sized to be used with the High Caliber Gun. Attempting to load it with lower caliber ammunition can result in jamming or other firing mishaps.
outfits.description: Genesis ammunition, professionally manufactured by their industrial mass production factories, is a critical element to many of their weapons. Quality control measures at these facilities make them less likely to jam.

outfits.name: High Calibur Boxes
outfits.description: High Caliber Ammo Boxes are used to store extra ammunition for High Caliber Guns.

outfits.name: High Calibur Depot
outfits.description: The High Caliber stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use High Caliber Ammo. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: High Calibur Gun
outfits.description: Genesis mechanical weapons technology is far ahead of their energy weapons development. The loading systems on them are less likely to jam compared to species that put more resources on developing their energy weapons.

outfits.name: Hydrogen Missile
outfits.description: [Hydrogen Missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]

outfits.name: Icicle Gun
outfits.description: Genesis mechanical weapons technology is far ahead of their energy weapons development. The loading systems on them are less likely to jam compared to species that put more resources on developing their energy weapons.

outfits.name: Cryogenic Cooler
outfits.description: A Cryogenic Cooler applies cryogenic technology to efficiently maintain the internal temperature of your ship.

outfits.name: Cryogenic Hub
outfits.description: By itself, a Cryogenic Hub merely adds some cooling to your ship. Its actual purpose is to allow Cryogenic Coolers or other cryogenic technologies to be attached into its slots.

outfits.name: Cryostasis Pod
outfits.description: A Cryostasis Pod continuously draws on a modest amount of power to maintain a temperature controlled environment within. If the external temperature becomes excessive, it will pull on additional power to compensate.

outfits.name: Genesis Repair Bot
outfits.description: This large robot is able to patch holes in the hull of a ship that is still in flight. When not in use, it occupies a turret mount to recharge.

outfits.name: Genesis Narrowband Scanner
outfits.description: Genesis Narrowband Scanners are incredibly efficient once locked onto a target, but have a very short range.

outfits.name: Hydrogen Collector
outfits.description: This ramscoop is a necessary component in keeping fuel hungry ships from Genesis operational.

outfits.name: Genesis Battery
outfits.description: Genesis Batteries feature a high capacity for their size but they are more vulnerable to energy draining attacks than batteries of other species.

outfits.name: Genesis Fission
outfits.description: Fission Reactors used by the inhabitants of Genesis are very efficient at generating energy, but the methods used to make this possible leave them vulnerable against ionization.

outfits.name: Genesis Radiothermal
outfits.description: Radiothermal generators used by the inhabitants of Genesis are very efficient at generating energy, but the methods used to make this possible leave them vulnerable against ionization.

outfits.name: Genesis Photovoltaic Array
outfits.description: This solar collection array is more weight efficient than the ones commonly found in human space, but is also less sophisticated.

outfits.name: Genesis Photovoltaic Panel
outfits.description: The inhabitants of Genesis have solar collection technology that is less developed than other space faring species.

outfits.name: Genesis Thermionic
outfits.description: Thermionic radioisotopic generators used by the inhabitants of Genesis are very efficient at generating energy, but the methods used to make this possible leave them vulnerable against ionization.

outfits.name: Genesis Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This fuel cells used by the inhabitants of Genesis are very efficient at generating energy, but the methods used to make this possible leave them vulnerable against ionization.

outfits.name: Genesis Afterburner
outfits.description: Genesis Afterburners use a small amount of fuel combined with a burst of energy from your ship's batteries to produce a large amount of thrust.

outfits.name: Genesis Engines
outfits.description: Genesis Engines burn a small amount of hyperspace fuel to provide turning and thrusting to their ships.

outfits.name: Anti-Missile
outfits.description: This is similar to the Anti-Missile Turret you're familiar with.

outfits.name: Laser
outfits.description: This is similar to the Beam Laser you're familiar with.

outfits.name: Gat
outfits.description: This is similar to the Gatling Gun you're familiar with.

outfits.name: Tiny Battery
outfits.description: This is a tiny battery.

outfits.name: Small Battery
outfits.description: This is a small battery.

outfits.name: Medium Battery
outfits.description: This is a medium battery.

outfits.name: Engines
outfits.description: This is a compact steering and thrusting engine.

outfits.name: Battery
outfits.description: This is a battery.

outfits.name: Fusion
outfits.description: This is a fusion reactor.

outfits.name: Radiothermal
outfits.description: Radiothermal generators harvest heat from radioactive isotopes and convert it into electricity.

outfits.name: Scanner
outfits.description: This scanner allows you to determine what outfits are installed in the ship you are currently targeting, as well as scan the cargo holds. Installing more than one increases the scan range and speed.

outfits.name: Small Photovoltaic
outfits.description: This generates power when near a star.

outfits.name: Thermionic
outfits.description: Thermionic radioisotopic generators are a cooler-running alternative to other generators.

outfits.name: Tiny Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This tiny fuel cell generates power when installed on a ship.

outfits.name: Heavy Pulse Cannon
outfits.description: An antique rarely seen on modern Hai ships, many consider Heavy Pulse Cannons obsolete. However this weapon would be a valid alternative as a substitute for an Ion Cannon. It lacks the ability to disrupt an enemy ship's energy systems, but the power of its shots should not be underestimated.

outfits.name: Ion Pulse Cannon
outfits.description: Deployed at the start of the Unfettered invasion of Wanderer space, Ion Pulse Cannons disrupt the electrical systems on any ship they hit. Individually, they aren't as effective as Ion Cannons, but these weapons are meant to be used in multiples. As a group they synchronize their rate of fire, creating waves of ionizing projectiles.

outfits.name: Ion Pulse Turret
outfits.description: These turrets are designed to synchronize their rate of fire with each other as well as non-turreted Ion Pulse Cannons.

outfits.name: Komodo Anti-Missile
outfits.description: Long dormant projects to produce and distribute stronger anti-missile systems were reactivated after the Unfettered encountered Wanderer Thunderheads.

outfits.name: Pulse Repeater
outfits.description: Inspired by alien weapons installed on the ships of a hostile species the Hai fought long ago, Pulse Repeaters aren't for sale at Unfettered outfitters. However, any Unfettered engineer worth their acorns should be able to convert a regular Pulse Cannon into one. Whether or not they would be willing to do so is a separate issue.

outfits.name: Pulse Repeater Turret
outfits.description: Unfettered outfitters are unwilling to stock this weapon due to the potential of an alien inspired modification being perceived as superior to the original Hai version. Despite this, more than a few Unfettered starship captains have commissioned these conversions to gain an edge on the battlefield.

outfits.name: Hai Displacer
outfits.description: The Displacer only generates holographic decoys after it launches. Managing ammunition inventory would be unnecessarily difficult otherwise.

outfits.name: Displacer Storage Pod
outfits.description: The Unfettered now have a new hazing ritual to torture fresh recruits: They are instructed to double check the inventory and confirm that none of the stored Displacers are holographic.

outfits.name: Displacer Storage Depot
outfits.description: The Displacer Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Hai Displacers. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Hai Displacer Pod
outfits.description: Displacers are Trackers that have had their optical tracking hardware replaced with holographic projectors. These create phantom missiles that escort the Displacer towards its target, helping it to slip through the enemy's anti-missile defenses.

outfits.name: Hai Nutcracker
outfits.description: [Nutcracker missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]

outfits.name: Phantom Tracker (Gun)
outfits.description: Because the missile isn't real, guidance is accomplished entirely through visual positioning data fed into the Phantom Tracker.

outfits.name: Phantom Tracker (Turret)
outfits.description: Fortunately, most Hai tacticians are either retired or among the Unfettered.

outfits.name: Tracker Storage Depot
outfits.description: The Tracker Storage Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Hai Trackers. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to oversee maintenance of the ammunition.

outfits.name: Railgun Slug Depot
outfits.description: The Railgun Slug Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Railgun Slugs. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to maintain inventory.

outfits.name: Hai Heliotrope Regenerator
outfits.description: Heliotrope Regenerators have carried legendary warriors though the bloodiest of conflicts. However, the extreme heat it generates proved disastrous when the Hai faced an enemy prepared to abuse that weakness. Now, only the most courageous of the True Hai dare to install this on their ships.

outfits.name: Hai Mistral Cooling
outfits.description: The Unfettered once fought enemies whose weapons pushed their ships well past safe heat levels. Mistral Cooling systems were developed to defend against such attacks.

outfits.name: Ionic Snare
outfits.description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

outfits.name: Modified Hyperdrive (Hai)
outfits.description: At its height, the Hai empire stretched across an expanse almost double the size of human space. Fluctuator Drives are a relic of this bygone age. They are the result of research into making a fuel efficient Hyperdrive for facilitating travel from one end of the empire to the other.

outfits.name: Modified Nugget Finder
outfits.description: As its name suggests, the Nugget Finder was originally used by the ancient Hai to mine asteroids and harvest gas giants. However, the Unfettered discovered that a few subtle adjustments allow it to target a ship and identify the outfits it has installed.

outfits.name: Quantum Bloodstone
outfits.description: Quantum Bloodstones aren't for sale at regular outfitters. The few Hai who have them keep their source a closely guarded secret.

outfits.name: Dual Pulse Pistols
outfits.description: A pair of modified heavy pulse pistols favored by some Unfettered and the occasional pirate captain. Dual wielding them adds another gun during short raids against a ship's defenders. Individually, they lose their energy charge more quickly than a pulse rifle, making them a poor choice for holding a defensive position during a long siege.

outfits.name: Ion Flash Bang
outfits.description: Ion Flash Bangs are defensive weapons used by the Hai to create a disruptive ion burst that drains energy weapons of their charge while causing mechanical weapons to jam.

outfits.name: Ion Pulse Shotgun
outfits.description: A weapon stolen from Farpoint's evidence vault, this appears to be a heavily modified Hai Pulse Rifle. Twin barrels fire a pair of ion pulse blasts that collide as they rush towards the target, bursting into a spread that affects a wide area. Mechanical weapons caught in the blast temporarily become inoperable. Ironically, due to the intensity of the recoil, smaller species such as the Hai may find this weapon difficult to wield.

outfits.name: Quantum Dragon Blade
outfits.description: The hand guard has an intricate carving of a dragon on it. Holding it fills you with a sense of determination.

outfits.name: Quantum Key Blade
outfits.description: This Quantum Key Blade is an ancient Hai artifact from the era when their people still waged war on other alien races across the galaxy. The blade is forged from a single Quantum Key Stone of the highest quality. A design of the micro circuitry in the hand grip, the technological secrets of which have been lost to antiquity, sends a charge through the blade that alters the wielder's quantum alignment, granting the ability to walk through walls or other solid matter.

outfits.name: Quantum Phoenix Blade
outfits.description: The hand guard of this Quantum Key Blade has an intricate carving of a phoenix on it. You feel warm and refreshed while holding it.

outfits.name: Quantum Snake Blade
outfits.description: The hand guard of this Quantum Key Blade has an intricate carving of a snake on it. Holding it fills you with a sense of mischief.

outfits.name: Quantum Tiger Blade
outfits.description: The hand guard of this Quantum Key Blade has an intricate carving of a tiger on it. It consumes a fair bit of energy while charging. You feel invigorated just from holding it in your hands.

outfits.name: Quantum Turtle Blade
outfits.description: The hand guard of this Quantum Key Blade has an intricate carving of a turtle on it. You feel contemplative and aloof while in possession of it.

outfits.name: Unfettered Militia License
outfits.description: The Unfettered Militia license exists in both verbal and physical form: Simply claim that you have one. If anyone objects, physically convince them of their error in judgement. It's the Unfettered way.

outfits.name: Tracker Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Tracker Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Hai Trackers. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Hai Trackers even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Railgun Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Railgun Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Railgun Slugs. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Railgun Slugs even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Displacer Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area in future visits to the outfitter.

outfits.name: Displacer Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Hai Displacers. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Hai Displacers even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Prototype Ramscoop FCX
outfits.description: This prototype isn't working as intended...

outfits.name: Prototype Lodestone Engine MDX
outfits.description: This prototype isn't working as intended...

outfits.name: Prototype Shield Modulator SD-DSD
outfits.description: This prototype isn't working as intended...

outfits.name: Prototype Cooling HGX
outfits.description: This prototype isn't working as intended...

outfits.name: Prototype Power Converter ECX
outfits.description: This prototype isn't working as intended...

outfits.name: Secret Prototype
outfits.description: A secret prototype stolen from a merchant vessel. You have no idea how it works.

outfits.name: Smuggled Cargo
outfits.description: Cargo stolen from a smuggler which has caught the interest of a pirate warlord.

outfits.name: Secret Data
outfits.description: Secret data on an encrypted chip. You have no clue what the contents are.

outfits.name: Barracks
outfits.description: This converts part of your cargo bay into barracks for use by combat grunts. Typically, the living conditions in these cramped quarters are unsuitable for paying passengers.

outfits.name: Barracks (Burned)
outfits.description: This is an eyesore and a waste of space. Perhaps you should have this mess cleaned out while you're at the outfitter.

outfits.name: Broadband Amplifier
outfits.description: This device cannot be installed on a ship that doesn't already have equipment for scanning both cargo and outfits.

outfits.name: Bunk Room (Burned)
outfits.description: This is an eyesore and a waste of space. Perhaps you should have this mess cleaned out while you're at the outfitter.

outfits.name: D41-HY Shielding (Damaged)
outfits.description: A malfunction in this generator is causing reduced performance, excessive energy consumption, and waste heat. It also seems to be causing a slight delay before the shield regeneration process actually begins.

outfits.name: Detachable Heat Sink
outfits.description: Most pilots have little use for this antiquated form of heat management technology. But some outfitters still keep them in stock to satisfy a niche market of high performance pilots in search of alternative methods to manage the heat on their ships.

outfits.name: Engineering Room
outfits.description: Engineering Rooms are also often the location where a ship's self-destruct sequence is activated. Typically it involves deliberately causing a reactor meltdown in the ship's power systems or some similar catastrophic failure. At a minimum, this usually requires the cooperation of both the captain and the engineering crew.

outfits.name: Fuel Canister
outfits.description: A Fuel Canister increases your fuel capacity slightly. It's not enough to make a hyperspace jump, but can provide extra reserves for an afterburner.

outfits.name: Fuel Canister (Reinforced)
outfits.description: Although this carries less fuel than a regular Fuel Canister, it has a thicker armored casing that protects against leaks.

outfits.name: Fuel Pod (Reinforced)
outfits.description: Although this carries less fuel than a regular Fuel Pod, it has a thicker armored casing that protects against leaks.

outfits.name: Fuel Tank
outfits.description: A Fuel Tank increases your fuel capacity greatly, enough to power a Scramdrive for one additional hyperspace jump.

outfits.name: Fuel Tank (Reinforced)
outfits.description: Although this carries less fuel than a regular Fuel Tank, it has a thicker armored casing that protects against leaks.

outfits.name: Hull Repair Equipment
outfits.description: Before hull repairs can begin there is a delay while the crew analyzes the damage to determine how to fix it.

outfits.name: Industrial Ramscoop
outfits.description: An Industrial Ramscoop is often used to supplement deuterium harvesting operations on space stations. It's bulkier than a regular ramscoop but is able to process hyperspace fuel more efficiently.

outfits.name: Infiltrator Tech
outfits.description: The Infiltrator has this specialized scan interference and radar jamming technology integrated into the hull. It also features an optical jamming feature that causes the shields to shimmer in a way that helps the ship blend in with starry backgrounds. Data on its inner workings is classified information not available to the general public.

outfits.name: Limit Breaker
outfits.Berserker Circuit: after the first ship it was used in. Many consider the development of this device a reckless attempt to push a ship's combat abilities to its maximum limits. But installing a Limit Breaker on your ship allows it to keep functioning well past the point that it would be disabled due to internal safety mechanisms shutting your systems down.
outfits.description: Installing more than one of these outfits reduces their effectiveness as they interfere with each other as well as your ship's internal safety shutdown systems.

outfits.name: Liquid Metal Hull
outfits.description: This hull can reshape itself, making it compatible with a variety of hull technologies.

outfits.name: Modified D14-RN Shielding
outfits.description: Modifications to this outfit have increased its rate of shield generation. However it consumes considerably more energy while also generating heat as a result of being pushed to perform beyond the intended specifications it was designed for. Note that these after market alterations voids the manufacturer's warranty.

outfits.name: Modified D23-QP Shielding
outfits.description: Modifications to this outfit have increased its rate of shield generation. However it consumes considerably more energy while also generating heat as a result of being pushed to perform beyond the intended specifications it was designed for. Note that these after market alterations voids the manufacturer's warranty.

outfits.name: Modified D41-HY Shielding
outfits.description: Modifications to this outfit have increased its rate of shield generation. However it consumes considerably more energy while also generating heat as a result of being pushed to perform beyond the intended specifications it was designed for. Note that these after market alterations voids the manufacturer's warranty.

outfits.name: Modified D67-TM Shielding
outfits.description: Modifications to this outfit have increased its rate of shield generation. However it consumes considerably more energy while also generating heat as a result of being pushed to perform beyond the intended specifications it was designed for. Note that these after market alterations voids the manufacturer's warranty.

outfits.name: Modified D94-YV Shielding
outfits.description: Modifications to this outfit have increased its rate of shield generation. However it consumes considerably more energy while also generating heat as a result of being pushed to perform beyond the intended specifications it was designed for. Note that these after market alterations voids the manufacturer's warranty.

outfits.name: Modified Hyperdrive
outfits.description: Rumors speculate that these Modified Hyperdrives are artifacts discovered in alien ruins on a planet in the Northern Frontier. There's no evidence to support such claims, but the list of humans who understand the inner workings of the hyperdrive is short and none of them have stepped forward to take credit for creating this.

outfits.name: Modified Jammer
outfits.description: This device has been altered to interfere with scanners instead of radar. A professional smuggler's tool, most security inspectors lack the technical expertise to distinguish between this and a normal radar jammer.

outfits.name: North Wind Cooling
outfits.description: An advanced air duct cooling system developed by North Wind. While bulkier than the industry standard cooling ducts, this new system offers additional emergency cooling if the ship starts to overheat.

outfits.name: Prototype D122-ZX Shielding
outfits.description: This experimental generator draws immense energy while producing a massive amount of waste heat, reminiscent of the modified generators sometimes used by pirates.

outfits.name: Prototype T88-AO Shielding
outfits.description: This experimental generator draws immense energy while producing a massive amount of waste heat. It also temporarily overloads once the ship's shields have been depleted.

outfits.name: Shield Suppressor
outfits.description: If you find this installed on your ship, get rid of it as soon as possible!

outfits.name: Small Bunk Room (Burned)
outfits.description: This is an eyesore and a waste of space. Perhaps you should have this mess cleaned out while you're at the outfitter.

outfits.name: Smuggler's Hideaway
outfits.description: This hidden compartment, lined with a material similar to Interference Plating, helps conceal part of your cargo bay from scans and searches.

outfits.name: Spycraft Adapter
outfits.description: This is Navy technology, designed to plug into an expansion port hidden underneath a standard Navy Surveillance Pod. This boosts the power of the pod while incurring only a minor reduction in efficiency.

outfits.name: Gnome Core
outfits.description: A collaboration between Deep Sky and Turner Inc. The Gnome Core is a more powerful Dwarf Core, offering an amazing amount of power in a compact generator.

outfits.name: Fission S2 Reactor
outfits.description: A collaboration between Syndicated Systems and Turner Inc. The Fission S2 offers more efficiency than the Fission Reactor with only a modest increase in size.

outfits.name: Heavy Fusion Core
outfits.description: A collaboration between Lovelace Labs and Turner Inc. The Heavy Fusion Core is a new entry in the energy generator market, using innovations in reactor design to deliver a superior fusion reactor.

outfits.name: H6 Refrigeration Module
outfits.description: As a cooling device, this prototype refrigeration module is a complete failure at preventing spoilage of food and other perishables that require cold storage. But there is another potential use for it. The energy feedback generated when it activates can be utilized for powering other systems on a ship. Despite the steam rising off of its surface, you're certain using it this way won't cause it to blow up. Probably.

outfits.name: LCT-2 Photovoltaic Rod
outfits.description: This array has two photovoltaic panels mounted on it. Some of the energy collected is lost as it is transferred into the ship.

outfits.name: LCT-4 Photovoltaic Wand
outfits.description: This array has four photovoltaic panels mounted on it. Some of the energy collected is lost as it is transferred into the ship.

outfits.name: LCT-6 Photovoltaic Staff
outfits.description: This array has six photovoltaic panels mounted on it. Some of the energy collected is lost as it is transferred into the ship.

outfits.name: Modified nGVF-AA Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This fuel cell has been modified to store some of the energy it generates. However, it is not as efficient as a standard fuel cell of the same size.

outfits.name: Modified nGVF-BB Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This fuel cell has been modified to store some of the energy it generates. However, it is not as efficient as a standard fuel cell of the same size.

outfits.name: Modified nGVF-CC Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This fuel cell has been modified to store some of the energy it generates. However, it is not as efficient as a standard fuel cell of the same size.

outfits.name: Modified nGVF-DD Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This fuel cell has been modified to store some of the energy it generates. However, it is not as efficient as a standard fuel cell of the same size.

outfits.name: Modified nGVF-EE Fuel Cell
outfits.description: This fuel cell has been modified to store some of the energy it generates. However, it is not as efficient as a standard fuel cell of the same size.

outfits.name: Modified RT-I Radiothermal
outfits.description: Some claim that the technique used to make these modified radiothermals originated from stolen research data regarding one of Tarazed's failed experiments. Whenever asked about this topic, the company always denies the validity of such rumors.

outfits.name: QT-800 Nucleovoltaic
outfits.description: Tarazed's research into Quarg technology has had some unexpected findings. This prototype generator, for example, is able to achieve a significantly higher power output than the Nucleovoltaics produced by Deep Sky. Yet it is unable to do so consistently. Testing results reveal a pattern of energy spikes accompanying incidents when the test ship was overheating. However the reason for this has yet to be solved, baffling even Tarazed's most knowledgeable scientists.

outfits.name: TP036q Battery Pack
outfits.description: Research on Quarg technology has enabled Tarazed to develop this higher capacity battery. Unfortunately, it becomes unstable when exposed to high temperatures, losing its ability to retain the energy stored within. Insufficient generators can result in a cascade failure that can drain other batteries.

outfits.name: TP072q Battery Pack
outfits.description: Research on Quarg technology has enabled Tarazed to develop this higher capacity battery. Unfortunately, it becomes unstable when exposed to high temperatures, losing its ability to retain the energy stored within. Insufficient generators can result in a cascade failure that can drain other batteries.

outfits.name: TP144q Battery Pack
outfits.description: Research on Quarg technology has enabled Tarazed to develop this higher capacity battery. Unfortunately, it becomes unstable when exposed to high temperatures, losing its ability to retain the energy stored within. Insufficient generators can result in a cascade failure that can drain other batteries.

outfits.name: TP288q Battery Pack
outfits.description: Research on Quarg technology has enabled Tarazed to develop this higher capacity battery. Unfortunately, it becomes unstable when exposed to high temperatures, losing its ability to retain the energy stored within. Insufficient generators can result in a cascade failure that can drain other batteries.

outfits.name: TP576q Battery Pack
outfits.description: Research on Quarg technology has enabled Tarazed to develop this higher capacity battery. Unfortunately, it becomes unstable when exposed to high temperatures, losing its ability to retain the energy stored within. Insufficient generators can result in a cascade failure that can drain other batteries.

outfits.name: Hybrid Afterburner
outfits.description: A modified afterburner that also taps into your ships batteries for additional power, providing an increased burst of speed.

outfits.name: Archaic Afterburner
outfits.description: An afterburner works by dumping hyperspace fuel into your engines and igniting it, producing a large amount of thrust. This can be very useful for dodging missiles or briefly escaping from faster opponents, but you must be careful to avoid using up so much fuel that you do not have enough left for hyperspace travel.

outfits.name: Sunracer Afterburner
outfits.description: Designed for use in racing, this afterburner draws power from your ships batteries as well as hyperspace fuel, providing an increased burst of speed.

outfits.name: Chimera Junk Thruster
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Griffin Junk Thruster
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Hippogriff Junk Thruster
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Manticore Junk Thruster
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Tarasque Junk Thruster
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Chimera Junk Steering
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Griffin Junk Steering
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Hippogriff Junk Steering
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Manticore Junk Steering
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Tarasque Junk Steering
outfits.description: Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.

outfits.name: Antique Rifle
outfits.description: This rifle was in use prior to the Alpha War. While not significantly better or worse than modern rifles, collectors will pay a premium for it.

outfits.name: Blaster Pistol
outfits.description: Blaster Pistols rose to prominence as side-arms during the Alpha wars, but use charger packs instead of bullet magazines. Most manufacturers stopped producing them after the war due to increased production costs for the charger packs.

outfits.name: DFN-53 Android
outfits.description: Despite this, some captains commissioned these directly from their inventor. This defense android does little to assist with shipboard operations. Instead, it was programmed to protect the ship from hostile boarders. Unfortunately, it quickly becomes disoriented when forced to fight in unfamiliar territory, preventing it from being effective outside of your ship.

outfits.name: Dual Mod Blaster Pistols
outfits.description: A pair of rare Modified Blaster Pistols. A person could burn through a lot of charger packs with these.

outfits.name: Execution Chamber
outfits.description: This is a specially designed room which can be installed in your ship. Anyone who boards you in an attempt to take over your ship will find themselves locked in this room by the self sealing doors. A pair of small portholes allow your crew to safely sweep the chamber with weapons fire from the other side of the reinforced bulkhead.

outfits.name: Guncraft
outfits.description: An old relic from the early turf wars, the Guncraft is considered by many to be the pinnacle of handgun design. This particular one is starting to show small traces of rust on it, which could impact its performance and collectability. The basic model has a well balanced grip and precision sigting, but there are rumors of Guncrafts that have been transformed into terrifying weapons by skilled gunsmiths.

outfits.name: Isochronal Laser Rifle
outfits.description: This miniaturized rifle version has a significantly extended battery life over other laser rifles. It also runs cooler, making it unlikely to overheat from prolonged use.

outfits.name: Medical Bay
outfits.description: A medical bay staffed by a trained doctor helps keep your crew in good health, boosting morale. When defending the ship, injured crew members will likely be brought here for treatment, often making defense of the medical bay a rallying point of interest in tense boarding battles.

outfits.name: Modified Blaster Pistol
outfits.description: A complex modification allows this rare version of the Blaster Pistol to fire a more powerful energy blast, but doing so will burn out the charger pack. This has created an insatiable demand for functioning charger packs.

outfits.name: Purger Rifle
outfits.description: Purger Rifles are sometimes used as part of clandestine biohazard containment protocols. They fire Euthanasia rounds which ensure a quick and painless death for anyone unfortunate enough to be infected with experimental pathogens. Each rifle comes with four additional magazines to ensure an uninterrupted dispersal of mercy. A hollow point injector attachment holds additional inoculations for virulent infestations that enter melee range.

outfits.name: Sniper Rifle
outfits.description: A single armor piercing bullet can change the course of history. A good scope helps too.

outfits.name: Security Station (Staffed)
outfits.description: Dedicated security staff posted at this station helps to ensure that the ship is protected during boarding battles.

outfits.name: Tactical Laser Rifle
outfits.description: The Tactical Laser Rifle adds a spare battery pack, allowing for longer combat engagements. Its sturdier frame also requires less regular maintenance and protects the internal components if the wielder opts to use this as a bludgeoning weapon. For the additional cost, these benefits are widely considered to be negligible for non-military use.

outfits.name: Miscellaneous Cargo
outfits.description: A variety of different trade goods haphazardly stuffed into a single crate...

outfits.name: Blaster Charger
outfits.description: A charger pack for a Blaster Pistol. You might win a special prize if you bring this to Bailey in the Citadelle system and survive the Puppetmaster's challenge...

outfits.name: Contraband
outfits.description: Illegal merchandise found in a smuggler's cargo bay. You might be able to sell it for a profit if the authorities haven't caught you with it first.

outfits.name: Drone Hacking
outfits.description: Keep this installed on your flagship for easy reference when you find a suitable drone to hack.

outfits.name: Eureka Map
outfits.description: You must have this installed on your flagship in order to use it when you land at the designated location.

outfits.name: Research Data
outfits.description: This is general data covering a wide variety of sciences but specializing in none.

outfits.name: Research Data (Bio)
outfits.description: This is biology data often associated with, but not limited to, argicultural, medical, and terraforming studies.

outfits.name: Research Data (Chem)
outfits.description: This is chemistry data often associated with, but not limited to, developing weapons and various compounds.

outfits.name: Research Data (Phys)
outfits.description: This is physics data often associated with, but not limited to, graviton, quantum, and weft theory.

outfits.name: Spirit Board
outfits.description: A simple wooden plank with letters and numbers etched onto its surface, this ancient item is associated with the occult. Supposedly, it can attract the attention of entities who exist outside our mortal realm...

outfits.name: Subsidurial Plushie
outfits.description: Keep this installed on your flagship to show your support for the Subsi and Friends show!

outfits.name: Syndicate Bond (Titania)
outfits.description: This bond was issued to fund the creation of Titania Station in the Eteron system. Once the Syndicate has enough funding for this project, these bonds will no longer be available.

outfits.name: Syndicate Stock (Common)
outfits.description: After the destruction of the Galactic Stock Exchange, the Syndicate began buying and selling shares of their corporate common stock through outfitters on worlds under their control.

outfits.name: Alien Torture Device
outfits.description: A machine assembled from scavenged parts that appear to be alien in origin. It creates a burst of energy that causes extreme pain. While not harmful enough to kill its victims, this device can be used to torture captured defenders until they reveal the codes for bypassing a ship's internal security locks.

outfits.name: Almachian Brain Maggots
outfits.description: A jar of writhing alien worms. After one is inserted into the victim's ear, there are several moments of agonizing pain and suffering before the victim dies. While not a practical combat weapon, the threat of being tortured to death by these creatures is often enough to persuade a captured crew member to give up the security codes for bypassing the ship's internal door locks.

outfits.name: Balthazar Model
outfits.description: A 1/100th scale model of the District ship, Balthazar. Some assembly required.

outfits.name: Biohazard Gas
outfits.description: This illegal weapon designed for hand-to-hand combat seems to have been developed through experiments using the gas produced by Pug Biodefenses on unwilling human test subjects.

outfits.name: Carabao AI
outfits.description: This computer regulates all of the automated systems on the Carabao city ship.

outfits.name: Catapult Schematics
outfits.description: The schematics for the Asteroid Catapult that was installed on the Thermopylae space battle station. Without a skilled engineer willing to actually make one, these are just pictures on a computer screen.

outfits.name: Cloaking Device (Damaged)
outfits.description: You're sure the cloaking device is here somewhere. You can't see it, but you can feel the heat it is generating.

outfits.name: CRG-0 Android
outfits.description: Despite this, some captains commissioned these directly from their inventor. This cargo android does little to assist with most shipboard operations. Instead, it was programmed to load cargo bays with a focus on making effective use of the available space, allowing more cargo to be crammed onto a ship. However, this can make retrieving a specific package more difficult than some would consider worth the effort.

outfits.name: Fake Coffin
outfits.description: This box appears to be a coffin. However its inner surface is lined with a material similar to interference plating. Only the most cold hearted investigator with a strong stomach would dare open it up to inspect the contents.

outfits.name: Guncraft I
outfits.description: An old relic from the early turf wars, the Guncraft is considered by many to be the pinnacle of handgun design. This particular one has been kept in perfect condition. The basic model has a well balanced grip and precision sigting, but you've heard rumors of gunsmiths who possess the knowledge and skill to make parts modifications that could transform it into a terrifying weapon.

outfits.name: Guncraft II
outfits.description: This upgraded version of the Guncraft features an improved rifled barrel, increasing the weapon's range.

outfits.name: Guncraft III
outfits.description: This upgraded version of the Guncraft features a larger magazine for more ammo.

outfits.name: Guncraft IV
outfits.description: This upgraded version of the Guncraft features a laser guided tactical aim assist system, displaying range data while also marking the target.

outfits.name: Guncraft V
outfits.description: Mag-rail Slugs aren't sold in shops, requiring you to modify regular bullets instead. This adds a small operating cost to the Guncraft to ensure you have a steady supply of ammunition.

outfits.name: Guncraft VI
outfits.description: Detonator Rounds aren't sold in shops, requiring you to modify regular bullets instead. This adds a small operating cost to the Guncraft to ensure you have a steady supply of ammunition.

outfits.name: Guncraft VII
outfits.description: Ionic Rounds aren't sold in shops, requiring you to modify regular bullets instead. This adds a small operating cost to the Guncraft to ensure you have a steady supply of ammunition.

outfits.name: Guncraft VIII
outfits.description: Atomic Bullets aren't sold in shops, requiring you to modify regular bullets instead. This adds a small operating cost to the Guncraft to ensure you have a steady supply of ammunition.

outfits.name: Leviathan Comic
outfits.description: The first issue of Drugub's comic book inspired by human ship designs. The art looks good, but you can't read Arach.

outfits.name: Leviathan Comic #1
outfits.description: After a decade, this has become a rare collector's item.

outfits.name: Lionheart Sponsorship
outfits.description: (Operating income will not be paid while this ship is parked.)

outfits.name: Melchior Post Card
outfits.description: An old fashioned post card with a photo depicting Melchior on the day it was launched from the Old Port on Zug.

outfits.name: Microwave Cannon
outfits.description: Papa Grudge's custom weapon. It emits a cone of blistering heat, making it difficult for the enemy to maintain a defensive position. While not immediately lethal, prolonged exposure can cause blindness, disfigurement, and ultimately leads to a slow and agonizing death. This sort of weapons modification violates several consumer safety laws and regulations, so don't expect to find one of these for sale at any legitimate outfitter.

outfits.name: Syndicate Stock (Preferred)
outfits.description: Shares of Syndicate preferred stock are no longer available for purchase. The last batch was issued over 200 years ago. The Syndicate still disburses dividends for existing shares owned by those fortunate enough to have them.

outfits.name: T.H.O.R.
outfits.description: When this is installed on a ship, a dedicated maintenance crew must be hired for it.

outfits.name: T.H.O.R. (Damaged)
outfits.description: Although it is not able to be deployed, you should keep this installed on your ship to prevent it from being mixed in with the regular cargo.

outfits.name: Crystal Key
outfits.description: In all his travels, Han never found the door. Or perhaps he did but never shared the knowledge of what lay beyond. Most scholars familiar with the tale have concluded that some, if not all, aspects of this story are completely fabricated.

outfits.name: Deep Security License
outfits.description: That's classified.

outfits.name: Inferno Dragon License
outfits.description: The Inferno Dragon's ambition reaches the heavens.

outfits.name: Sunracer License
outfits.description: Solus League races require a ship to have no crew other than the pilot and weigh less than 250 tons.

outfits.name: Solus Champion License
outfits.description: Geminae League races require a ship to have no crew other than the pilot and weigh less than 200 tons.

outfits.name: Geminae Champion License
outfits.description: Tertio League races require a ship to have no crew other than the pilot and weigh less than 150 tons.

outfits.name: Tertio Champion License
outfits.description: Tertio Champions are sometimes offered jobs and opportunities not available to other racing pilots.

outfits.name: Solus Token
outfits.description: Grants access to Checkpoint Solus.

outfits.name: Geminae Token
outfits.description: Grants access to Checkpoint Geminae.

outfits.name: Tertio Token
outfits.description: Grants access to Checkpoint Tertio.

outfits.name: Double Anti-Missile Turret
outfits.description: The Double Anti-Missile Turret fills the role of a medium weight anti-missile weapon. Its high rate of fire makes it an ideal choice for thinning out missile swarms.

outfits.name: Energy Cannon
outfits.description: A relic from the Alpha War, Energy Cannons fell into disuse once the war ended. Occasionally they can still be found outfitted on older ships. They are more powerful than Energy Blasters and cover a longer range. But their rate of fire is slower and the effectiveness of the projectiles diminishes the more distant the target.

outfits.name: Energy Cannon Turret
outfits.description: The turreted version of the Energy Cannon consists of a single Energy Cannon mounted onto a rotating base. If there is any one factor that lead to the decline of this weapon, it might be the relatively slow turret turn rate which made it difficult to aim at fighters that were growing increasingly nimble as newer designs were developed.

outfits.name: Isochronal Laser
outfits.description: These were never adopted for widespread use and Tarazed was eventually forced to stop production of them due to poor sales. Ships in the South can sometimes be found with these rare weapons installed. However the vast majority of Isochronal Lasers are still held by Tarazed itself.

outfits.name: Isochronal Laser Turret
outfits.description: This turreted version of the Isochronal Laser appeals to a very niche market of pilots who want an upgrade to Deep Sky's Laser Turret, but lack the space for Heavy Lasers on their ships.

outfits.name: Kludge Blaster
outfits.description: Kludge Blasters started out as a failed attempt at modifying an Energy Blaster. Despite their shady origins, the most basic version eventually gained widespread popularity as a budget alternative mining weapon and are available at many legitimate outfitters across the galaxy.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Twin Kludge Blaster
outfits.description: Pirate captains short on cash due to botched raid attempts or an unlucky night at the card tables might resort to mounting Kludge Blasters onto their ship instead of more effective weapons. Jamming two Kludge Blasters into a single gun port was one innovation that spawned copycats among other blaster designers. The localized cluster fire exhibited in them harkens back to this original design.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Triple Kludge Blaster
outfits.description: The pressures of war inspired weaponsmiths to figure out how to squeeze even more Kludge Blasters into a single gun port. This increases the damage yield at the cost of increased heat buildup.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Kludge Blaster Turret
outfits.description: Pirate captains short on cash due to smuggling jobs gone wrong, or an unlucky run at the dog races might resort to mounting Kludge Blasters onto their ship instead of more effective weapons. Unlike other blaster turrets, both barrels of the Kludge Blaster Turret fire simultaneously. It was hoped that launching the projectiles in a volley would help compensate for the weapon's slow rate of fire.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Quad Kludge Blaster Turret
outfits.description: While the Kludge Blaster is considered a poor man's weapon among pirates, tinkerers continue to see potential in connecting several of them together. All four Kludge Blasters mounted on this turret fire at the same time, launching a deadly volley of projectiles towards the target.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Hex Kludge Blaster Turret
outfits.description: Overzealous weaponsmiths crafted this arrangement of six Kludge Blasters clustered onto a single turret mount. This increases the damage yield at the cost of increased heat buildup. As with other Kludge Blaster configurations, all six fire at the same time, launching a deadly volley of projectiles towards the target.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Modified Plasma Turret
outfits.description: This Plasma Turret only has a single Plasma Cannon mounted on it. While not as fearsome as Kraz's Plasma Turret, it is far more accessible.

outfits.name: Twin Particle Cannon
outfits.description: Both barrels of the Twin Particle Cannon fire simultaneously, releasing double the force of a single Particle Cannon all at once. The size of this weapon is its main drawback, as few ships can accommodate it. While this product is fully functional, the sales department has raised concerns about its viability in the marketplace.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Particle Burst Turret
outfits.description: This weapon is still in development and is unavailable to the general public. A few lucky pilots with connections within the company have been given access to prototypes for field testing.

outfits.name: Plasma Cluster Cannon
outfits.description: The Plasma Charge Cannon has been modified to take advantage of concentrated firing mounts. The power and range of each shot has increased at the expense of increasing the weapon's charge up time.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Proton Gun-CF8
outfits.description: Four out of five reviewers at Stars and Starships Magazine criticized the Proton Gun-CF8 as a blatant marketing gimmick meant to appeal to Vanguard aficionados. The lone dissenting review praised the aesthetic appeal of its projectile firing pattern.
outfits.cluster: mode, synchronizing its rate of fire when multiple copies are installed together.

outfits.name: Proton Turret-ATS
outfits.description: The Syndicate Proton Turret-ATS was designed for the cost conscious captain concerned about keeping crew wages under control. No gunner is required to operate this turret. Instead, aiming is accomplished by utilizing an advanced automated targeting system which has been in development for several years. Critics note it has lower accuracy and response times than a skilled human gunner. Despite this, some captains consider the trade off worthwhile.

outfits.name: Prototype Anti-Missile
